properties.displayName: [format('Enable Azure Monitor for Azure VMs - {0}', parameters('policyAssignmentName'))]
properties.description: Automatically configures Windows and Linux Azure VMs with Azure Monitor Agent using user-assigned managed identity and associates with unified Data Collection Rule

nonComplianceMessages.message: Azure VMs must have Azure Monitor Agent installed with user-assigned managed identity and configured with the unified Data Collection Rule

properties.scriptContent:
param([string]$PolicyAssignmentId)

$ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'

Write-Host "========================================"
Write-Host "POLICY REMEDIATION - Azure VMs"
Write-Host "========================================"
Write-Host "Policy Assignment ID: $PolicyAssignmentId"
Write-Host ""

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($PolicyAssignmentId)) {
    Write-Host "No policy assignment ID provided" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{}
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Skipped'
    exit 0
}

# Wait for policy to propagate
Write-Host "Waiting 90 seconds for policy propagation..."
Start-Sleep -Seconds 90

$remediations = @()
$successCount = 0
$failCount = 0

try {
    # Get policy assignment details
    $policyAssignment = Get-AzPolicyAssignment -Id $PolicyAssignmentId -ErrorAction Stop
    
    Write-Host "Policy Assignment: $($policyAssignment.Name)"
    Write-Host "Scope: $($policyAssignment.Properties.Scope)"
    Write-Host ""
    
    # Define all policy definition reference IDs to remediate
    $policiesToRemediate = @(
        @{ Name = "Managed Identity Assignment"; ReferenceId = "AddUserAssignedManagedIdentity_VM" },
        @{ Name = "Windows AMA Installation"; ReferenceId = "DeployAzureMonitoringAgentWindows" },
        @{ Name = "Windows DCR Association"; ReferenceId = "DataCollectionRuleAssociation_Windows" },
        @{ Name = "Linux AMA Installation"; ReferenceId = "DeployAzureMonitoringAgentLinux" },
        @{ Name = "Linux DCR Association"; ReferenceId = "DataCollectionRuleAssociation_Linux" }
    )
    
    $policyNumber = 1
    $totalPolicies = $policiesToRemediate.Count
    
    foreach ($policy in $policiesToRemediate) {
        Write-Host "[$policyNumber/$totalPolicies] Creating remediation for: $($policy.Name)" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        
        try {
            $remediationName = "remediate-$($policy.ReferenceId.ToLower())-$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyyMMddHHmmss')"
            
            $remediation = Start-AzPolicyRemediation `
                -Name $remediationName `
                -PolicyAssignmentId $PolicyAssignmentId `
                -PolicyDefinitionReferenceId $policy.ReferenceId `
                -ResourceDiscoveryMode ReEvaluateCompliance `
                -ErrorAction Stop
            
            Write-Host "  ✓ SUCCESS: $($remediation.Id)" -ForegroundColor Green
            $successCount++
            
            $remediations += @{ 
                Name = $policy.Name
                ReferenceId = $policy.ReferenceId
                RemediationId = $remediation.Id
                Status = "Created" 
            }
        }
        catch {
            Write-Host "  ✗ FAILED: $($_.Exception.Message)" -ForegroundColor Red
            $failCount++
            
            $remediations += @{ 
                Name = $policy.Name
                ReferenceId = $policy.ReferenceId
                Error = $_.Exception.Message
                Status = "Failed" 
            }
        }
        
        Write-Host ""
        $policyNumber++
    }
    
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "REMEDIATION SUMMARY"
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "Total Policies: $totalPolicies"
    Write-Host "✓ Successful: $successCount" -ForegroundColor Green
    if ($failCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host "✗ Failed: $failCount" -ForegroundColor Red
    }
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host ""
    
    if ($successCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host "Remediation tasks are running in the background" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        Write-Host "Check Azure Portal > Policy > Compliance for progress" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        Write-Host "Azure VMs will be configured automatically within 15-30 minutes" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    }
    
    if ($failCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host ""
        Write-Host "Some remediation tasks failed. You can create them manually:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "  1. Go to Azure Portal > Policy > Compliance"
        Write-Host "  2. Select the policy assignment"
        Write-Host "  3. Click 'Create remediation task' for failed policies"
    }
    
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{}
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['remediations'] = $remediations | ConvertTo-Json -Compress
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['totalPolicies'] = $totalPolicies
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['successCount'] = $successCount
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['failCount'] = $failCount
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Completed'
}
catch {
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "ERROR"
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host $_.Exception.Message -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "You can create remediation tasks manually from Azure Portal" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{}
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Failed'
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['error'] = $_.Exception.Message
}

properties.displayName: [format('Enable Azure Monitor for Hybrid VMs with AMA - {0}', parameters('policyAssignmentName'))]
properties.description: Automatically configures Windows and Linux Arc-enabled servers with Azure Monitor Agent using user-assigned managed identity and associates with unified Data Collection Rule

nonComplianceMessages.message: Arc-enabled servers must have Azure Monitor Agent installed and configured with the unified Data Collection Rule

properties.scriptContent:
param([string]$PolicyAssignmentId)

$ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'

Write-Host "========================================"
Write-Host "POLICY REMEDIATION - Arc Servers"
Write-Host "========================================"
Write-Host "Policy Assignment ID: $PolicyAssignmentId"
Write-Host ""

if ([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($PolicyAssignmentId)) {
    Write-Host "No policy assignment ID provided" -ForegroundColor Yellow

    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Skipped'
    exit 0
}

# Wait for policy to propagate
Write-Host "Waiting 90 seconds for policy propagation..."
Start-Sleep -Seconds 90

$remediations = @()
$successCount = 0
$failCount = 0

try {
    # Get policy assignment details
    $policyAssignment = Get-AzPolicyAssignment -Id $PolicyAssignmentId -ErrorAction Stop
    
    Write-Host "Policy Assignment: $($policyAssignment.Name)"
    Write-Host "Scope: $($policyAssignment.Properties.Scope)"
    Write-Host ""
    
    # Get all policy definitions in the initiative
    Write-Host "Retrieving policy definitions..." -ForegroundColor Cyan
    $policySet = Get-AzPolicySetDefinition -Id $policyAssignment.Properties.PolicyDefinitionId -ErrorAction Stop
    
    $totalPolicies = $policySet.Properties.PolicyDefinitions.Count
    Write-Host "Found $totalPolicies policies in the initiative"
    Write-Host ""
    
    $policyNumber = 1
    
    foreach ($policyDef in $policySet.Properties.PolicyDefinitions) {
        $policyRefId = $policyDef.policyDefinitionReferenceId
        $policyName = if ($policyDef.policyDefinitionId -match '/([^/]+)$') { $matches[1] } else { $policyRefId }
        
        Write-Host "[$policyNumber/$totalPolicies] Creating remediation for: $policyName" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        
        try {
            $remediationName = "remediate-arc-$($policyRefId.ToLower() -replace '[^a-z0-9-]', '-')-$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyyMMddHHmmss')"
            
            $remediation = Start-AzPolicyRemediation `
                -Name $remediationName `
                -PolicyAssignmentId $PolicyAssignmentId `
                -PolicyDefinitionReferenceId $policyRefId `
                -ResourceDiscoveryMode ReEvaluateCompliance `
                -ErrorAction Stop
            
            Write-Host "  ✓ SUCCESS: $($remediation.Id)" -ForegroundColor Green

            $remediations += @{ 
                Name = $policyName

        }
        catch {
            Write-Host "  ✗ FAILED: $($_.Exception.Message)" -ForegroundColor Red
            $failCount++
            
            $remediations += @{ 
                Name = $policyName
                ReferenceId = $policyRefId
                Error = $_.Exception.Message
                Status = "Failed" 
            }
        }
        
        Write-Host ""
        $policyNumber++
    }
    
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "REMEDIATION SUMMARY"
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "Total Policies: $totalPolicies"
    Write-Host "✓ Successful: $successCount" -ForegroundColor Green
    if ($failCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host "✗ Failed: $failCount" -ForegroundColor Red
    }
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host ""
    
    if ($successCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host "Remediation tasks are running in the background" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        Write-Host "Check Azure Portal > Policy > Compliance for progress" -ForegroundColor Cyan
        Write-Host "Arc servers will be configured automatically within 15-30 minutes" -ForegroundColor Cyan
    }
    
    if ($failCount -gt 0) {
        Write-Host ""
        Write-Host "Some remediation tasks failed. You can create them manually:" -ForegroundColor Yellow
        Write-Host "  1. Go to Azure Portal > Policy > Compliance"
        Write-Host "  2. Select the policy assignment"
        Write-Host "  3. Click 'Create remediation task' for failed policies"
    }
    
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{}
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['remediations'] = $remediations | ConvertTo-Json -Compress
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['totalPolicies'] = $totalPolicies
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['successCount'] = $successCount
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['failCount'] = $failCount
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Completed'
}
catch {
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host "ERROR"
    Write-Host "========================================"
    Write-Host $_.Exception.Message -ForegroundColor Red
    Write-Host ""
    Write-Host "You can create remediation tasks manually from Azure Portal" -ForegroundColor Yellow
    
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs = @{}
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['status'] = 'Failed'
    $DeploymentScriptOutputs['error'] = $_.Exception.Message
}

allOf.query: InsightsMetrics | where Namespace == "Processor" and Name == "UtilizationPercentage" | where Val > 95 | summarize AggregatedValue = avg(Val) by Computer, _ResourceId, bin(TimeGenerated, 5m)

[format('InsightsMetrics | where Namespace == "Memory" and Name == "AvailableMB" | extend TotalMemory = todouble(parse_json(Tags)["vm.azm.ms/memorySizeMB"]) | extend UsedPercent = 100.0 - ((Val / TotalMemory) * 100.0) | where UsedPercent > {0} | summarize AggregatedValue = avg(UsedPercent) by Computer, _ResourceId, bin(TimeGenerated, 5m)', parameters('memoryThreshold'))]

properties.description: Alert when disk free space is below 5%

allOf.query: InsightsMetrics | where Origin == "vm.azm.ms" | where Namespace == "LogicalDisk" and Name == "FreeSpacePercentage" | extend Disk = tostring(todynamic(Tags)["vm.azm.ms/mountId"]) | extend FreeSpace = Val | summarize FreeSpace = min(FreeSpace) by Computer, Disk, _ResourceId | where FreeSpace < 5

properties.description: Alert when disk metrics stop reporting but machine is sending heartbeat

allOf.query: let tmp = Heartbeat | where TimeGenerated > ago(6h) | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by Computer | extend maxhhearbeat=TimeGenerated | extend cname= tolower(replace_string(Computer,".softjam.it","")) | project maxhhearbeat,cname; InsightsMetrics | where Origin == "vm.azm.ms" | where Namespace == "LogicalDisk" and Name == "FreeSpacePercentage" | extend Disk = tostring(todynamic(Tags)["vm.azm.ms/mountId"]) | extend FreeSpace = Val | where TimeGenerated > ago(6h) | extend Computer=tolower(Computer) | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Computer, Disk | join kind=leftouter tmp on $left.Computer==$right.cname | where TimeGenerated < ago(30min) | where maxhhearbeat > ago(20m)

properties.description: Alert when machine stops sending heartbeat for 10+ minutes

allOf.query: InsightsMetrics | where TimeGenerated > ago(1d) | where Name == "Heartbeat" | where Computer != "sgescheduler01" | summarize TimeGenerated = max(TimeGenerated) by Computer, _ResourceId | where TimeGenerated < ago(10m)

properties.description: Alert when Azure AD Connect services are stopped

allOf.query: ConfigurationData | where SvcDisplayName in~ ("Microsoft Azure AD Sync", 'Check point identity collector','azure ad connect health sync insights service', 'azure ad connect health sync monitoring service') and SvcState contains "Stopped" | order by TimeGenerated desc

properties.description: Alert when critical Domain Controller services are stopped

allOf.query: ConfigurationData | where SvcDisplayName in~ ('active directory web services', 'dfs replication', 'dns server', 'kerberos key distribution center', 'workstation', 'netlogon', 'active directory domain services', 'remote procedure call (rpc)', 'windows time', 'intersite messaging') and Computer in~ ('SAZDC22', 'SAZDC23', 'SGEDC03', 'SGEDC01') and SvcState contains "Stopped" | order by TimeGenerated desc
